author: Dave Nickerson
text: Dallas was the 688 in Red October..

author: Mark Broster FRiN, AFNi, FIlM, FIMarEST, HCMM
text: Great movie. A Scottish Russian submarine commander. One of my favourites

author: Guy King
text: Ryan - I think you summed it up at “Elon Musk is strange-could have been a Supply Officer”. No need for anything else😁

author: Christopher Beech MSc FCMI
text: Interesting that an immigrant into the USA has pinned his colours to the anti-immigration cause. Maybe not all immigrants are equal?

author: Kelvin Blackburn
text:
Christopher Beech MSc FCMI maybe the difference is legal against illegal…..?

The USA is not anti immigration. It is built on it.

Same could be said for taking some things from the shop (money goes back into the business). Some do it in line with the law - we pay for the goods. Others take and do not pay - illegal (money is taken out of the business and causes fiscal strain).

Not my country, so can’t really project my own thoughts more beyond this simple take.

I would however share my sentiment towards our own countries borders and the unmanageable number of illegal immigrants arriving on our shores.

author: Tim Davies
text: Confirm our range to target; one ping only!

author: Karen Barnes MCIPD
text: Tim Davies one of my favourite films 😊

author: Kelvin Blackburn
text:
One man’s strange is another man’s visionary.

I imagine they used to think Nikolas Tesla and Leonardo da Vince were strange…..

author: John Gardner
text: Very sadly, that sub might have been more seaworthy than some of the real Soviet things. Reassuring that Sir Sean seems to have got his set legs in this shot. Re Musk, fill in the gap, “The Hunt for …..”

author: Patrick Tyrrell
text: He’d be one of the first to be loaded into a torpedo tube!

author: Craig Harffey 🦍
text: What an amazing photo from one of my favourite films

author: Malcolm Warr
text: As the first supply officer appointed to a UK SSN I doubt whether Elon Musk's combative style of management would work well in the confines of a submarine spending prolonged periods at sea

author: Dr. Finn Majlergaard 🇪🇺🇫🇷
text: Malcolm Warr Let us just send him to space then in one of his own rocket ships
